metadata.title: CVE-2024-35855 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mlxsw:spectrum_acl_tcam: Fix possible use-after-free during activity update Therule activity update delayed work periodically traverses the list ofconfigured rules and queries their activity from the device. As part ofthis task it accesses the entry pointed by 'ventry->entry', but this entrycan be changed concurrently by the rehash delayed work, leading to ause-after-free [1]. Fix by closing the race and perform the activity queryunder the 'vregion->lock' mutex. [1] BUG: KASAN: slab-use-after-free inmlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_flower_rule_activity_get+0x121/0x140 Read of size 8 ataddr ffff8881054ed808 by task kworker/0:18/181 CPU: 0 PID: 181 Comm:kworker/0:18 Not tainted 6.9.0-rc2-custom-00781-gd5ab772d32f7 #2 Hardwarename: Mellanox Technologies Ltd. MSN3700/VMOD0005, BIOS 5.11 01/06/2019Workqueue: mlxsw_core mlxsw_sp_acl_rule_activity_update_work Call Trace:<TASK> dump_stack_lvl+0xc6/0x120 print_report+0xce/0x670kasan_report+0xd7/0x110mlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_flower_rule_activity_get+0x121/0x140mlxsw_sp_acl_rule_activity_update_work+0x219/0x400process_one_work+0x8eb/0x19b0 worker_thread+0x6c9/0xf70 kthread+0x2c9/0x3b0ret_from_fork+0x4d/0x80 ret_from_fork_asm+0x1a/0x30 </TASK> Allocated bytask 1039: kasan_save_stack+0x33/0x60 kasan_save_track+0x14/0x30__kasan_kmalloc+0x8f/0xa0 __kmalloc+0x19c/0x360mlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_entry_create+0x7b/0x1f0mlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_vchunk_migrate_all+0x30d/0xb50mlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_vregion_rehash_work+0x157/0x1300process_one_work+0x8eb/0x19b0 worker_thread+0x6c9/0xf70 kthread+0x2c9/0x3b0ret_from_fork+0x4d/0x80 ret_from_fork_asm+0x1a/0x30 Freed by task 1039:kasan_save_stack+0x33/0x60 kasan_save_track+0x14/0x30kasan_save_free_info+0x3b/0x60 poison_slab_object+0x102/0x170__kasan_slab_free+0x14/0x30 kfree+0xc1/0x290mlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_vchunk_migrate_all+0x3d7/0xb50mlxsw_sp_acl_tcam_vregion_rehash_work+0x157/0x1300process_one_work+0x8eb/0x19b0 worker_thread+0x6c9/0xf70 kthread+0x2c9/0x3b0ret_from_fork+0x4d/0x80 ret_from_fork_asm+0x1a/0x30

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-116-generic - 5.15.0-116.126
linux-image-5.15.0-116-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-116.126
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-116-generic - 5.15.0-116.126
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-116-generic-64k - 5.15.0-116.126
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1062-kvm - 5.15.0-1062.67
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1068-azure - 5.15.0-1068.77
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1068.77.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1064-gcp - 5.15.0-1064.72
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1062-gke - 5.15.0-1062.68
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1048-gkeop - 5.15.0-1048.55
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1058-ibm - 5.15.0-1058.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1060-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1060.66
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1060-nvidia - 5.15.0-1060.61
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1060-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1060.61
No subscription required

No subscription required
